definitions.definition: come so close to (an object) as to be or come into contact with it.
examples: the dog had one paw outstretched, not quite touching the ground
synonyms: be against "his shoes were touching the end of the bed"

definitions.definition: bring one's hand or another part of one's body into contact with.
examples: he touched a strand of her hair
synonyms: put a hand to "he touched her cheek"

definitions.definition: come or bring into mutual contact.
examples: for a moment their fingers touched

definitions.definition: be tangent to (a curve or surface) at a certain point.
reach (a specified level or amount).
examples: sales touched twenty grand last year

definitions.definition: be comparable to in quality or excellence.
examples: there's no one who can touch him at lightweight judo
synonyms: be in the same class/league as
beat; informalhold a candle to "nobody can touch her when she's on her game"

definitions.definition: handle in order to manipulate, alter, or otherwise affect, especially in an adverse way.
examples: I didn't play her records or touch any of her stuff
synonyms: make use of "you're not supposed to touch the computer"

definitions.definition: cause harm to (someone).
examples: I've got friends who'll pull strings—nobody will dare touch me

definitions.definition: consume or use (food, drink, money, etc.).
examples: the beer by his right hand was hardly touched

definitions.definition: used to indicate that something is avoided or rejected.
examples: he was good only for the jobs that nobody else would touch

definitions.definition: ask someone for (money or some other commodity) as a loan or gift.
examples: he touched me for his fare

definitions.definition: have an effect on; make a difference to.
examples: a tenth of state companies have been touched by privatization
synonyms: change "people whose lives have been touched by the recession"

definitions.definition: (of a quality or expression) be or become visible or apparent in.
examples: a wry smile touched his lips

definitions.definition: lightly mark in features or other details with a brush or pencil.
produce feelings of affection, gratitude, or sympathy in.
examples: she was touched by her friend's loyalty
synonyms: tug at someone's heartstrings; Moreleave an impression on
have an effect on "years later she wrote to tell them how much their kindnesses had touched her"

definitions.definition: slightly insane.
an act of touching someone or something.
examples: her touch on his shoulder was hesitant
synonyms: graze; hand "he felt her touch on his shoulder"

definitions.definition: the faculty of perception through physical contact, especially with the fingers.
examples: reading by touch

definitions.definition: a musician's manner of playing keys or strings.
the manner in which a musical instrument's keys or strings respond to being played.
examples: Viennese instruments with their too delicate touch

definitions.definition: a light stroke with a pen, pencil, etc.
an act of asking for and getting money or some other commodity from someone as a loan or gift.
examples: I only tolerated him because he was good for a touch now and then

definitions.definition: a thing or an action that tries out the worth or character of something; a test.
examples: you must put your fate to the touch

definitions.definition: a small amount; a trace.
examples: add a touch of vinegar

definitions.definition: a detail or feature, typically one that gives something a distinctive character.
examples: the film's most inventive touch
synonyms: accessory "the oil lamps are a nice touch"

definitions.definition: a distinctive manner or method of dealing with something.
examples: later he showed a surer political touch

definitions.definition: an ability to deal with something successfully.
examples: getting caught looks so incompetent, as though we're losing our touch

definitions.definition: a series of changes shorter than a peal.
short for touch football.
